instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message:
Hello.

I have receive a 820-2936B board that don't show anything on the screen only backlight running.
Wher do i start on this one? i have no idea what happened with the card before i get it. it`s no since to water damage.
(the happy apple sound come on startup)

Thanks for all help

Regards
Glenn

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message:
Getting 3V on both sides of L9004?
Did you do a PRAM reset? Disconnect everything besides the LCD?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message:
Sorry for late replay. on L9004 i only get 0.279V
Yes i have tray a PRAM reset and that doesn't helps.
Have disconnected all expect the LCD and still get 0.279V

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message: but i think i have a short on that line... when i put red prob on ground and black on L9004 pin1 in diode mode i get OL

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message:
Think i have a broken U9000. When i put the black prob on ground and the red on u9000 pin 5 i get pictures on the screen :) so hopefully it is only to change that i hope.

(when i measuring from ground to to u9000 pin 6 i get 0,468 and no piiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiip but if i press the prob down on the board it say piiiiiiiip)

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message: Have replace the u9000 and now all is OK!

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message: But i have 2 more board off this type. They only show backlight and nothing more. I have 3.3v all way too the lvds connector. Have disconnected all exept keyboard, fan and screen. Have tray a PRAM reset. when i measuring in diode mode on u9000 pin 1-5 i get 0,132

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message: They show backlight with a "darkish" not white screen?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message: Yes its more gray/darkish then white. Its like the photo on the first post.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message: Measure all LVDS lines on diode mode, pin 8-18.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message: Have also tried new lcd with new cable.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message: If i run extern screen whit from thunderbolt screen the extern screen show pictures. (When disconnected the internal screen)

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message:
As you can see pin 14 is the odd one out, this is a dead PCH. You will need to replace the PCH and flash a clean ME region. You can upload your original ROM here and I can fix it.

You said you had 2 boards? What are the values on the other one, don't assume the PCH is also dead.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message:
Sorry dukefawks im pretty new in board repar and realy dont know what PCH is and have no idea how to take copy or flash ME region. 

On the other board i found 3 fucked components L9004 is blow away whit the pin on the board and c9010 and L9008 is burned. 

I will not touch the other board befor i have fixed the second one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message: The PCH is U1800 and you need programmer to read/flash the ROM like TL866 or EZP2010.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message:
Ohh that sounds really hard for a newbie to do.. 
But no after replacing u9000 i get 0.605 on pin 14.

How do I actually remove the u1800? Hot air? How do I replace it? Rebelling?

(And the backlight feel more withe and not grey ish)

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message: Will take a new photo off the screen tomorrow

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message:
Replacing U9000 because of pin 14???? what where?? What are you doing? The PCH is dead!

You beed a BGA rework station and experience. These are not boards to practice on, get a trash PC laptop board and practice BGA rework on that.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message: u9000 doesn't attach to pin 14. the 820-2936 is a $250 board, which isn't worth a $30 chip, 45 minutes of BGA work, and the risk that the chip you bought is bad/not the only problem.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message:
The reason that I changed the u9000 was because that guy I bought the MacBook from had replaced this one before and turned this one 180*.

I bought the whole macbook for around 90usd. Its not a customer MacBook i only do this for hobby and hoping to learn something. and hopefully sell this after it work and mabye earn a litle on it even if i use 5 houses on it maby i have learned something after.


Do i need a expensive BGA machine or can i buy a expensive for around 2-400usd?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message: Any rework station under $1K is generally crap. I'm pretty sure Louis has a few videos about them.

What more i need to do that job? 

Will check louis youtube.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
threads.message: 2 off 3 motherboard OK. Only this with brooken PCH again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 No pictures
